title: THE SEMANTICS OF EVALUATIVITY
description: Author: Jessica Rett Edition: UK ed. edition Publication Date: January 27, 2015 Publisher: Oxford University Press ISBN-10: 0199602484 ISBN-13: 978-0199602483 Pages: 216 pages Format: pdf Size: 2.0M --- This book focuses on the semantic phenomenon of evaluativity and its consequences across constructions. Evaluativity has traditionally been associated exclusively with the positive construction, a term for sentences with a gradable adjective but with no overt degree morphology. John is tall is evaluative because it entails that John is tall relative to a contextually valued standard. John is taller than Sue and John is as tall as Sue are not evaluative because both could be used even if John and Sue were short. --- http://dlfeb.com/book/semantics-of-evaluativity-oxford-studies-in-theoretical-linguistics/
